A **straw golem**, ', is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The straw golem is one of the weakest types of [golem](/wiki/Golem "Golem") in the [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class"), and is likely to be the first one a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") encounters.

Straw golems have two claw attacks, and possess [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance") and [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") like all golems. A straw golem that is subjected to [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning") will become a [stone golem](/wiki/Stone_golem "Stone golem").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) [Fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire") damage that sets a straw golem aflame can cause them to burn up completely;[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) straw golems that take damage from [fire traps](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap"), the fire effect of [magic traps](/wiki/Magic_trap "Magic trap") and the fire effect of [container traps](/wiki/Container_trap "Container trap") can lose maximum [HP](/wiki/HP "HP") up to 1⁄2 of that maximum plus one.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) A hero [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into a straw golem can also burn up if they take fire damage, including losing up to half their current form's maximum HP plus one from the same traps;[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)[\[7\]](#cite_note-7) dying in this manner returns them to normal form, even if they are wearing an [amulet of unchanging](/wiki/Amulet_of_unchanging "Amulet of unchanging").[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

## Generation

Randomly-generated straw golems are always created hostile. Straw golems are always generated with 20 HP.[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)

Straw golems can generate as a result of [polypiling](/wiki/Polypiling "Polypiling") if there are enough [liquid](/wiki/Liquid "Liquid"), [wax](/wiki/Wax "Wax"), [veggy](/wiki/Veggy "Veggy"), [dragon hide](/wiki/Dragon_hide "Dragon hide"), or [plastic](/wiki/Plastic "Plastic") objects in a pile of items.[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)

A straw golem [does not leave behind a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death. They are not a valid target for [genocide](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide").

## Strategy

Hostile straw golems are not especially threatening with their weak claw attacks, unless the hero is low on HP and struggling to gain distance from one. In a pinch, any available source of fire damage (such as a [wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire") or a lit [potion of oil](/wiki/Potion_of_oil "Potion of oil")) can be used to instantly destroy one.

## History

The straw golem first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"). From this version to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"), including some variants based on those versions, casting [stone to flesh](/wiki/Stone_to_flesh "Stone to flesh") at a [statue](/wiki/Statue "Statue") or [figurine](/wiki/Figurine "Figurine") of a golem produces a single [meatball](/wiki/Meatball "Meatball"), since any golem other than the [flesh golem](/wiki/Flesh_golem "Flesh golem") or [leather golem](/wiki/Leather_golem "Leather golem") is considered "[vegetarian](/wiki/Vegetarian "Vegetarian")" due to not being composed of normally-edible material - this is fixed in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0") via [commit d8a0f734](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/d8a0f734815d6d0d81151c7222e63efbfe3f7cd4) so that doing so produces a live flesh golem.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Golem](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golem "wikipedia:Golem")***

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Straw man (dummy)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Straw_man_\(dummy\) "wikipedia:Straw man (dummy)")***

The *gōlem* is an animate, anthropomorphic being that originates from Jewish folklore, and is created entirely from inanimate matter, usually clay or mud. The most famous golem narrative is "The Golem of Prague", which tells of the late 16th century rabbi Judah Loew ben Bezalel and his creation of a golem using clay from the Vltava River, which he brought to life to defend the Prague ghetto from anti-Semitic attacks and pogroms. In modern popular culture, the word became generalized to refer to any crude anthropomorphic construct that is made of inanimate material and brought to life by some means, with the method of animation and the resulting creation's sapience and/or sentience varying wildly.

The straw golem is primarily based on a "straw man", a humanoid dummy that is either made entirely out of straw material, or consists of straw stuffed into clothes. Straw men are commonly used as [scarecrows](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scarecrow "wikipedia:Scarecrow"), combat training targets, swordsmiths' test targets, effigies to be burned, and as rodeo dummies to distract bulls - some variants of *NetHack* model straw golems more closely to scarecrows by having them drop a [fedora](/wiki/Fedora "Fedora") upon death, and the [encyclopedia](/wiki/Encyclopedia "Encyclopedia") entry is a description of [the Scarecrow](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scarecrow_\(Oz\) "wikipedia:Scarecrow (Oz)") from the *Oz* series of books by L. Frank Baum.

## Messages

- \<The straw golem> burns completely!

  A straw golem was hit with fire damage that destroyed it instantly.

- You smell burning straw.

  As above, while you are [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), straw golems are always generated with 40 HP and [hit as a +1 weapon](/wiki/Hits_creatures_as_%2Bx_weapon "Hits creatures as +x weapon").[\[11\]](#cite_note-11)

Polypiling enough plastic objects will instead create a [plastic golem](/wiki/Plastic_golem "Plastic golem"), while polypiling enough wax objects will create a [wax golem](/wiki/Wax_golem "Wax golem").

### NetHack brass

In [NetHack brass](/wiki/NetHack_brass "NetHack brass"), straw golems leave behind multiple [sheaves of straw](/index.php?title=Sheaves_of_straw\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sheaves of straw (page does not exist)") upon death, unless they are burnt up completely by fire damage.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), straw golems that are not burnt up completely by fire damage leave behind 2-8 [sheaves of hay](/index.php?title=Sheaves_of_hay\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sheaves of hay (page does not exist)") upon death, with a separate 1⁄10 chance of dropping a [sedge hat](/index.php?title=Sedge_hat\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sedge hat (page does not exist)") as well.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), the straw golem's glyph is changed to '.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, [scythes](/wiki/Scythe "Scythe") have +6 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and +20 damage bonuses against straw golems.

As part of the incorporated [biodiversity patch](/wiki/Biodiversity_patch "Biodiversity patch"), straw golems that are not burnt up completely by fire damage have a 2⁄3 chance of leaving behind one or more sheaves of straw upon death, and a separate 1⁄2 chance of leaving behind an [eroded](/wiki/Eroded "Eroded") [fedora](/wiki/Fedora "Fedora").

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), polypiling enough plastic or wax objects will create a [plastic golem](/wiki/Plastic_golem "Plastic golem") or [wax golem](/wiki/Wax_golem "Wax golem") rather than a straw golem, similar to SLASH'EM.

## Encyclopedia entry

Dorothy leaned her chin upon her hand and gazed thoughtfully at the Scarecrow. Its head was a small sack stuffed with straw, with eyes, nose, and mouth painted on it to represent a face. An old, pointed blue hat, that had belonged to some Munchkin, was perched on his head, and the rest of the figure was a blue suit of clothes, worn and faded, which had also been stuffed with straw. On the feet were some old boots with blue tops, such as every man wore in this country, and the figure was raised above the stalks of corn by means of the pole stuck up its back.

\[ The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, by L. Frank Baum ]

==Generation==
Randomly-generated straw golems are always created hostile. Straw golems are always generated with 20 HP.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|1971|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

Straw golems can generate as a result of [[polypiling]] if there are enough [[liquid]], [[wax]], [[veggy]], [[dragon hide]], or [[plastic]] objects in a pile of items.{{refsrc|src/zap.c|1345|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=straw golems act as fall-through for making golem out of materials that are not listed in specific cases}}

A straw golem [[Corpseless|does not leave behind a corpse]] upon death. They are not a valid target for [[genocide]].

==Strategy==
Hostile straw golems are not especially threatening with their weak claw attacks, unless the hero is low on HP and struggling to gain distance from one. In a pinch, any available source of fire damage (such as a [[wand of fire]] or a lit [[potion of oil]]) can be used to instantly destroy one.

==History==
The straw golem first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]]. From this version to [[NetHack 3.4.3]], including some variants based on those versions, casting [[stone to flesh]] at a [[statue]] or [[figurine]] of a golem produces a single [[meatball]], since any golem other than the [[flesh golem]] or [[leather golem]] is considered "[[vegetarian]]" due to not being composed of normally-edible material - this is fixed in [[NetHack 3.6.0]] via {{commit|d8a0f734815d6d0d81151c7222e63efbfe3f7cd4}} so that doing so produces a live flesh golem.

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Golem}}
{{wikipedia|Straw man (dummy)}}
The ''gōlem'' is an animate, anthropomorphic being that originates from Jewish folklore, and is created entirely from inanimate matter, usually clay or mud. The most famous golem narrative is "The Golem of Prague", which tells of the late 16th century rabbi Judah Loew ben Bezalel and his creation of a golem using clay from the Vltava River, which he brought to life to defend the Prague ghetto from anti-Semitic attacks and pogroms. In modern popular culture, the word became generalized to refer to any crude anthropomorphic construct that is made of inanimate material and brought to life by some means, with the method of animation and the resulting creation's sapience and/or sentience varying wildly.

The straw golem is primarily based on a "straw man", a humanoid dummy that is either made entirely out of straw material, or consists of straw stuffed into clothes. Straw men are commonly used as [[Wikipedia:Scarecrow|scarecrows]], combat training targets, swordsmiths' test targets, effigies to be burned, and as rodeo dummies to distract bulls - some variants of ''NetHack'' model straw golems more closely to scarecrows by having them drop a [[fedora]] upon death, and the [[encyclopedia]] entry is a description of [[Wikipedia:Scarecrow (Oz)|the Scarecrow]] from the ''Oz'' series of books by L. Frank Baum.

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], straw golems are always generated with 40 HP and [[Hits creatures as +x weapon|hit as a +1 weapon]].{{refsrc|makemon.c|2244|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}}

Polypiling enough plastic objects will instead create a [[plastic golem]], while polypiling enough wax objects will create a [[wax golem]].

===NetHack brass===
In [[NetHack brass]], straw golems leave behind multiple [[sheaves of straw]] upon death, unless they are burnt up completely by fire damage.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]], [[notnotdNetHack]], straw golems that are not burnt up completely by fire damage leave behind 2-8 [[sheaves of hay]] upon death, with a separate {{frac|10}} chance of dropping a [[sedge hat]] as well.

===FIQHack===
In [[FIQHack]], the straw golem's glyph is changed to {{orange|'}}.

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], in addition to SLASH'EM details, [[scythe]]s have +6 [[to-hit]] and +20 damage bonuses against straw golems.

As part of the incorporated [[biodiversity patch]], straw golems that are not burnt up completely by fire damage have a {{frac|2|3}} chance of leaving behind one or more sheaves of straw upon death, and a separate {{frac|2}} chance of leaving behind an [[eroded]] [[fedora]].

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], polypiling enough plastic or wax objects will create a [[plastic golem]] or [[wax golem]] rather than a straw golem, similar to SLASH'EM.
